definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: However, this position frequently requires three-month-long trips abroad. Is that acceptable?
sentences.chinese: 但是这职位，经常须要外派三个月左右，你能接受吗？

sentences.english: He abused his car by not changing the oil, and now it needs major repairs.
sentences.chinese: 他用车用得太狠，老不加油，现在车须要大修了。

sentences.english: We need a roadvertisingmap of the world.
sentences.chinese: 我们须要一张世界舆图。

sentences.english: Today's approval of new drugs in the international community needs to carry out the raw data transmission.
sentences.chinese: 如古旧药的审批须要反在邦际间入行本初数据的传输。

sentences.english: Finally, I would like to talk about how we need teachers of English writing courses.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我念说说我们须要如何的英语写做课程学师。

sentences.english: When you shoot an arrow , you draw the bow .
Urged by an extreme necessity, he had come there to steal food.
sentences.chinese: 在极度须要的驱策下，他才去那里偷食品。

sentences.english: If you needto change money, it is better to do this while you arestill at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 如果你须要兑换，当你还在机场时兑换会比较好。

sentences.english: I think that the on-site training will be necessary for the tank.
sentences.chinese: 我想槽罐烧焊事情的现场培养训练是须要的。

sentences.english: As long every man exists-there is some need of him; let him fight for his own.
sentences.chinese: 只消人保存，就有一些须要，让他为本身去搏斗吧。

sentences.english: A really excellent teacher needs to spend time learning.
sentences.chinese: 一个实正优良的教员须要花时间进修。

sentences.english: Were you able to adduce on all the items we need ?
sentences.chinese: 我们须要的每个项目你都能报价吗。

sentences.english: When you do this, you'll probably spot things that you have to change.
sentences.chinese: 当你这样做时，你就会发现须要修正的地方。

sentences.english: Nowhere to go, Nothing to do, No longer in a hurry.
sentences.chinese: 没处要去，无事要做，再不须要匆忙。

sentences.english: The image was to convey the dead mans hunger for guidance and spiritual sustenance, said Cayce.
sentences.chinese: 凯西说，这个画面表明逝世者须要指导和灵魂的养分。

definition: to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
not in such a way as to/not likely to
